subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Wearing white tape on her right shoulder Monday, Maria Sharapova played her first singles match on tour in nearly 10 months, and although she won, her game showed signs of rust. Sharapova, a three-time Grand Slam winner, needed nine match points to put away 68th-ranked Tathiana Garbin of Italy, 6-1, 6-7 (6), 6-3, in the first round of the Warsaw Open. Sharapova had surgery for a torn rotator cuff last year.
